parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "R",
"other_software": [
"singularity",
"pyCRISPRcleanR"
],
"resource_requirements": {
"memory": "2000MB",
"queue": "normal",
"output_file": "/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/logs/5972_pFH_vs_plasmid_combine_counts.o",
"error_file": "/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/logs/5972_pFH_vs_plasmid_combine_counts.e"
},
"input_files": [
"/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/sample_counts/Plasmid_Mouse_v2_library.counts",
"/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/sample_counts/pFH_1.counts",
"/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/sample_counts/pFH_2.counts",
"/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/sample_counts/pFH_3.counts",
"/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/scripts/combine_counts_pyCRISPRcleanR.R"
],
"output_files": [
"/lustre/scratch117/casm/team113/projects/5972_Identification_of_CoOperative_Oncogenic_Events_in_Fumarate_Hydratase_FH_Deficient_Tumours/analysis/pFH_vs_plasmid/pFH_vs_plasmid"
],
"singularity_image": "/software/team113/singularity_images/t113-singularity_r-3.6.0.base-1.0.1.sif"
}
```

This script uses the R programming language and the pyCRISPRcleanR library.  It runs within a Singularity container which uses the R image located at `/software/team113/singularity_images/t113-singularity_r-3.6.0.base-1.0.1.sif`. It requires 2GB of memory and runs in the normal queue. 

The script combines count files from the specified directory and outputs files to the specified output directory.
